intro: Ratibida picta, commonly known as the Mexican heather, is a species of flowering plant in the sunflower family. It is native to North America and is characterized by its bright yellow to orange flowers with a distinctive red center. The plant typically grows in open woods, prairies, and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are often branched and upright. Ratibida picta blooms from late summer to early fall, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
